description: Tiles placed on the board extend beyond the visible screen on both left and right sides as the chain grows, making them impossible to see. The board/camera should automatically zoom out as tiles are placed so that all laid-down tiles remain visible at all times. Players need to see all tiles to count points.
steps_to_reproduce: Step 1: Start a new game on any difficulty
Step 2: Play through several rounds until many tiles have been placed on the board
Step 3: Observe that the tile chain extends beyond the left and right edges of the visible canvas
Step 4: Tiles near the edges are cut off and not visible to the player

description: Non-double tiles are placed on the board without being flipped so the matching pip faces the connecting tile. For example, a 1-6 tile connecting to a 6-end should display as 6-1 (matching number adjacent), but it renders as 1-6 with the non-matching end facing the connection. This affects all non-double tiles for all players (human and AI) on both branches.
steps_to_reproduce: Step 1: Start a new game on any difficulty
Step 2: Play until several non-double tiles have been placed on the board
Step 3: Observe that non-double tiles do not have their matching pip oriented toward the adjacent connecting tile
Step 4: For example, tile 0-6 connects to the chain but shows 1-6 instead of 6-1 facing the connection point
resolved_session: Session 4: fixed rotation from CW to CCW and added flip logic

description: Tiles placed on the board have inconsistent spacing and visible gaps between them. Instead of forming a continuous contiguous chain, tiles appear fragmented with breaks between groups. This occurs from the very first tile placements and affects all difficulty levels.
steps_to_reproduce: Step 1: Start a new game on any difficulty level
Step 2: Play begins and tiles are placed on the board
Step 3: Observe gaps and inconsistent spacing between placed tiles immediately from the first placements
Step 4: The tile chain appears fragmented rather than forming a continuous connected layout
resolved_session: Session 5: fixed halfWidth formula and first-tile hor initialization
